tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V2.1.9 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Plaid
programme.desc: A pattern to unite the world, Kyle Ng travels from the United States to Scotland and Kenya looking for plaid. A pattern to unite the world, Kyle Ng dives into plaid's history. He visits Scotland, UK to see how tartan is part of a family's DNA, hangs with a low rider club in California, USA, and sees how the fabric is a part of tribal identity in Africa.

programme.title: Prepping for Panama
programme.desc: Parks Bonifay rounds up some friends for an epic wakeboarding adventure in Panama they’ll never forget. Parks Bonifay rounds up some friends for an epic wakeboarding adventure in Panama they’ll never forget. Before heading off to the airport, Brian Grubb and Steel Lafferty join Parks for one last wakeskating session.

programme.title: The Seaplane Escapade
programme.desc: After arriving in Nitro City, Panama, Parks Bonifray and crew go wakeboarding with a seaplane. After landing in Panama, Parks Bonifay, Brian Grubb, and Steel Lafferty prepare for a wakeboarding session with a seaplane. Later, Brian and pro wakeboarder Collin Harrington skydive from a seaplane – hanging from the pontoons on the way up.

programme.title: Rob Meets Julien Absalon
programme.desc: Rob Warner gets personal with the king of cross-country mountain biking, Julien Absalon. With five World Championships, two Olympic golds, and seven overall wins on the World Tour, Julien Absalon is the king of cross-country mountain biking. Rob Warner travels to France to hear from the man himself about preparing for his final season.

programme.title: Justen Allport
programme.desc: Justen Allport is a firefighter, but his passion for the big waves burns eternal. Justen Allport is used to danger. Being a firefighter would provide most with their fill of adrenaline, but to Justen it’s a means to an end. He’s been riding big waves since childhood, and now he charges the giant slabs of Cape Fear, Australia.

programme.title: Evan Faulks
programme.desc: Evan Faulks builds homes for a living, but his life’s foundation is his family and big wave surfing. Evan Faulks spends his day building and renovating homes. Through this, he’s able to support his family, improve his community of Maroubra, Australia, and spend his free time chasing the giant swells of nearby Cape Fear.

programme.title: Jack Kingsley
programme.desc: He holds down three different jobs to give him the freedom to go surf when the waves are huge. Jack Kingsley is a man who gets out of his comfort zone. That has landed him in a wide variety of jobs: carpet layer, ju-jitsu teacher, stunt man. It was this drive to try new things that tempted him to surf the huge waves of Australia’s Cape Fear.

programme.title: Exploring Madagascar
programme.desc: Slade Prestwich, Frank Solomon and Grant 'Twiggy' Baker embark on an epic surf adventure to Madagascar. Slade Prestwich, Frank Solomon and Grant 'Twiggy' Baker embark on an epic adventure to the previously unsurfed island of Madagascar. They chart new territory, searching for new waves to ride and meeting with local villagers.

programme.title: Hanging Spear
programme.desc: World class whitewater kayakers Steve Fisher and Pat Keller explore the Hanging Spear Gorge. Join world class whitewater kayakers Steve Fisher and Pat Keller as they explore the Hanging Spear Gorge of the Opalescent River, the highest source of the Hudson and the deepest part of New York State’s High Peaks wilderness.

programme.title: On the Roots of Cleopatra
programme.desc: Wakeskater Brian Grubb sessions at the pristine Cleopatra's Pool at the ruins of Hierapolis in Turkey. Always searching for unique places to wakeskate, Brian Grubb sessions at the pristine Cleopatra's Pool, a mineral-rich bath in the ruins of the ancient city of Hierapolis near modern day Denizli, Turkey.

programme.title: Epecuén
programme.desc: Danny MacAskill explores the lost Argentinian town that has been submerged for most of the past 25 years. Tragedy struck the town of Epecuén 25 years ago when rains flooded the streets. Now, Danny MacAskill hops on his trials bike to explore the lost Argentinian town, which has been submerged for the majority of time since.

programme.title: Escape. Create.
programme.desc: Dan Atherton designs intense BMX trails for himself and his sibling, brother Gee and sister Rachel. Something of a creative genius, mountain biker Dan Atherton designs intense, difficult trails for himself and his brother Gee, and sister Rachel. Watch as they perform amazing tricks on Dan's highly technical courses.

programme.title: People and Machines
programme.desc: With 20 days left until race day, the teams face unique challenges while getting ready for the starting line. With time running out, each of the teams face unique challenges while getting ready for race day. Whether it's diagnosing a mechanical problem, getting used to a new partner, or even completing the racecar, everyone is under the gun.

programme.title: Training and certification
programme.desc: After meeting his new team in Italy, Max gets behind the wheel to earn his F1 super licence. Team principal Franz Tost shows Max around the Scuderia Toro Rosso factory in Italy, to meet the team that will work on his car. After some simulator work, Max gets behind the wheel at the Adria International Raceway to earn his F1 super licence.

programme.title: Free diver
programme.desc: Freediving saved Stig Pryds's life. Now he's preparing to put his life on the line for his deepest dive yet. At his life's lowest point, Stig Pryds discovered freediving, and it changed everything. Now in the sport's biggest competition, Vertical Blue, he is preparing to attempt his deepest dive yet, but failure could cost him his life.

programme.title: High Tension
programme.desc: A violent altercation on Mount Everest uncovers some deep-seated tensions between climbers and Sherpas. While attempting a cutting edge new route on Mount Everest, Ueli Steck and Simone Moro are attacked by a crowd of angry Sherpas at Camp 2. The altercation exposes a deep-seated tension between climbers and Sherpas on the most crowded peak on Earth.

programme.title: Welcome aboard
programme.desc: The skateboarding crew check out the cruise ship and rip around some historic streets of Italy and Greece. The first leg of the Skate Cruise sets off from Rome and travels to Savona and Mykonos. With just hours to spend at each port, the sessions are fast paced and fully improvisational. There's no time to relax when you're a skateboarding tourist.

programme.title: Turkish delights
programme.desc: With more time to explore and great spots to skate, Turkey’s Izmir and Istanbul are the trip’s best stops yet. Turkey provides the trip’s best sessions so far, with more time to explore. Izmir offers some proper transition skating at the local park, and two days in Istanbul give the crew a chance to look for bigger street spots.

programme.title: To infinity and beyond
programme.desc: The final leg sees the crew in Bulgaria and Greece. On the water, the ship’s deck is a skate spot with a view. On the last leg of the cruise, the skateboarding crew lands in Bulgaria to the warmest (albeit wettest) reception of the tour. Then it’s back to Greece, where the boys go to work on Athens’ marble with some eye-catching tricks.

programme.title: Red Bull Music Studio Sessions: Kelly Rowland
programme.desc: Kelly Rowland and producers collaborate to share an artistic journey of music writing and recording. Go behind the scenes of a creative musical journey as a team of songwriters and producers write and record three tracks with superstar singer and artist Kelly Rowland at Red Bull Studios Los Angeles.
